record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, JUNE 29, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9:45 a.m. Friday, June 29. On Friday, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period for morning business with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
